citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
In the barn adjacent to the non-human primate indoor housing, the pigeons have sought shelter from an unusually severe
winter resulting in an accumulation of excreta in the barn. The indoor housing for the nonhuman primates is only
accessible by walking through the barn area. The facility has tried to keep the area clean, but needs to establish and
maintain an effective program to exclude pests to reduce the contamination in animal areas.
Correct by 15 March 2023

The area around the D street enclosures had an accumulation of items, included donated pallets of food, old freezers,
unused fencing and equipment and other items that create clutter and should be cleared as necessary to protect the
health of the animals.
Buildings and grounds shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the health of the animals and to facilitate
the prescribed husbandry practices.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the managers.
Additional Inspectors:
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
3.84(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
In the barn adjacent to the non-human primate indoor housing, the pigeons have sought shelter from an unusually severe 
winter resulting in an accumulation of excreta in the barn.  The indoor housing for the nonhuman primates is only 
accessible by walking through the barn area.  The facility has tried to keep the area clean, but needs to establish and 
maintain an effective program to exclude pests to reduce the contamination in animal areas.   
 
Correct by 15 March 2023 
3.131(c)  Repeat
   
Sanitation. 
The area around the D street enclosures had an accumulation of items, included donated pallets of food, old freezers, 
unused fencing and equipment and other items that create clutter and should be cleared as necessary to protect the 
health of the animals. 
 
Buildings and grounds shall be kept clean and in good repair in order to protect the health of the animals and to facilitate 
the prescribed husbandry practices.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the managers. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
William Campbell, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
